label: Description
value: The left half shows the vessel banded by wheat and rinceaux, with a bundle of wheat forming the handle. The finial is in the form of a basket holding a rose. Fluted columnar base with acanthus leaf capital and paw feet. The right half is adorned with a leaf motif and leaf and tendril forming the handle.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and washes

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Vessel heavily decorated with garlands, dolphins, birds, medallion (center). Finial in the form of a hunter and woman seated together. Left handle composed of a pair of half figures issuing from leaf clusters; right, of two eagles' heads. The vessel rests on paw feet and three seated dogs in the center. Base decorated with attributes of the hunt and is supported on paw feet.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and washes

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

value: Vessel heavily decorated with garlands, dolphins, birds, medallion (center). Finial in the form of a hunter and woman seated together. Design for a Tureen with Alternate Suggestions

label: Description
value: Design for a tureen with alternate schemes of decoration. The left half of the vessel is decorated with a handle composed of a cornucopia, and the base is banded with a grapevine meander and rests on a paw foot. The right half is banded by a repeating palmette motif and handle in the form of a plant stalk. Finial unadorned.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Provenance
value: Jean Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1911: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Three satyrs are shown seated upon a pedestal and supporting with their heads the ovoidal bowl which is decorated with a frieze in which Medusae alternate with an acanthus plant with a rosette in the center. Dragons as handles and a spread eagle over a thunder bolt on top of the cover.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: A crowd in fancy dress in a hall, showing a buffet in the center of a peristyle in the rear; the musicians are disposed in balconies left and right; onlookers in galleries above.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, watercolor, black chalk on white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Octagonal base and pedestal showing a woman on a sphere and ornamented candelabra. The shape is formed by a vase supporting another one which is topped by a peacock, and to which two branches are fastened. They end with the foreparts of eagle supporting a socket. Upon the left one stands a swan supporting a socket.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and watercolor, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The shaft consists of a column standing upon a high pedestal showing a palmette in the concave front panel. Octagonal plinth and four sockets on branches and a central one rising from a calyx over capital

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and wash, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Young shepherd, probably Paris, supports a scallop shell with his upraised arms. Three sockets with snail-like bottoms are fastened to the shell.

label: Physical description
value: Red crayon, pen and black ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Handle of ewer consists of a swan rising from the lap of mermaid. Two putti support a shell which serves as spout. A girl, a child, and rope-like festoons decorate the upper register of the ewer. Fluted lower portion on an acanthus leaf base; verso: design for coffee pot.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and wash, graphite on white laid paper

label: Credit line

label: Description
value: Handle of ewer consists of swan kissing harpy who is encircled by a crouching female satyr. The body is decorated in neoclassical style, fluting, rope-like festoons, a female mask, suspended fruit garlands, coiled snake forms base.

Design for a Cabinet and Pedestal Table

label: Description
value: At top of a cabinet on low legs, with flat top flanked by engaged columns, and intended to be partially gilded. Center panel open, with blue behind. Below, circular pedestal table, with top intended to be adorned with blue and white medallions. The lower shelf has three legs and below shows a table and scale.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and watercolor

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Crowd in formal dress in highly ornate hall.  Musicians on a loft over the door in the center rear.

value: Two plans of a circular formal garden, with paths radiating from a central grass plot. Upper plan included measurements.

Garden and Street Elevations of a Small Palace

label: Description
value: At left, garden elevation of a two-storied palace with seven bays in two ranges, and surmounted by a balustrade ornamented with urns and paired putti at the angles. At right, street elevation of the same building, with the portal and window over it featured by paired pilasters, carved panels of trophies and four urns breaking the roof balustrade.

value: Pen and ink, brush and watercolor on paper

value: Busts of women are shown in profile on top of the posts which consist of fluted columns supported by feet on a base. They are connected by an attic, which is flanked by scrolls. The bottom of the frame shows a garland and the top is molded.

The Rear Elevation of the Chateau de Boufflers

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and watercolor, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Elevation of a large horizontal building.  Entrances are in domed pavilions at either end of the building.  Attributes of the Arts are shown in triangular pediments above the entrances.  Four statues of allegorical women flanking the entrances represent possibly the Muses.  The pavilions are connected by a colonnade of embedded Doric columns and a short top story.  In each interval (between the columns) are a two-story window and a regular window.  Circular windows are placed at the basement level, below the colonnade.  Below the rendering are the rule "12 Toises" and the scale "48 modules."  Inscription on verso.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and gray and blue wash, over black chalk on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

Design for Elevation of Alcove Wall of Bedroom

label: Description
value: Frontal view of a bed alcove, framed squarely and hung with drapery, and flanked by single paneled doors. The panel over the alcove is decorated with an eagle encricled by a wreath.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
The elevation of the entrance wall of a drawing room with alternative suggestions

label: Description
value: Folding door in arched door frame, in the center. Attributes of the Arts and Hymen. Laterally are wall panels between pilasters. Different suggestions for their decoration are made at left and at right. The suggestion at left indicates putti, a genius and a girl supporting vessels. At right: trophies of attributes of the arts and a candelabrum scheme with a censer. Laterally, section of the entablature.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and grey wash with red crayon on off-white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Two bays are shown, each containing a representation of a hunting dog and a bird in a setting of trees. A single suggestion is made for the dado and the pilaster stripes. But subdivision in three panels is suggested at left, in two panels as the result of a correction at right. Three panels had originally been suggested at right also.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and red and black ink, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Chimney Wall in the Salon of the Prince de Chimay

label: Description
value: The chimney wall is flanked by double doors. Over the fireplace is a large mirror in a gilt frame decorated with garlands. The overdoors include trophies of musical instruments. The style of decoration is late Louis XV.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and watercolor on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Salt Cellar in the Shape of a Sleigh

label: Description
value: The forward part of the body of the vessel represents a centaur abducting a maiden, and behind, the body is in the form of a boat, over whose side hangs a lambrequin. The single runner shown, encircled by leaves, terminates in the figure of a bearded man with bow and arrow aimed at the centaur.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and grey wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Front elevation, left, and side elevations, right, of a cabinet in two sections. Above, a cupboard with glass doors and two drawers below.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and grey washes on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: A semicircular arched niche, flanked by panels and surmounted by a blind balustrade with urns. In the center, a basket of flowers from which hang garlands. A low bench runs around the nich. Alternating suggestions shown by designs of flanking panels.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Monument Flanked by Fountains

label: Description
value: Allegorical figures with trophies flank an obelisk with relief sculpture of trophies of warfare surrounding a blank escutcheon surmounted by a royal crown. The base of the monument has been left blank for inscription. Waterfalls at either side; trees in the background.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and watercolor on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Monument flanked by Fountains

label: Description
value: Allegorical figures with trophies flank an obelisk with relief sculpture of trophies of warfare surrounding a blank escutcheon surmounted by a royal crown. The base of the monument has been left blank for the inscription. Waterfalls at either sides; trees in the background. Framing line at bottom with undecipherable scribllings.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and watercolor on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Monument with Allegories

label: Description
value: Architectural screen with central arched bay flanked by rectangular panels extending forward and ornamented with columns and trophies above. In the center, a blank escutcheon surmounted by a royal crown and flanked by figures of classical warriors; above in a cloud three allegorical figures alluding to peace. In the tympanum of the central arch, a trophy of War, and the central bay is surmounted by a blank escutcheon surmounted by a royal crown and figures accompanying the implements of warfare.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and grey ink, brush and watercolor on paper

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux; 1911; Acquired by Museum through the Advisory Council.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Bell and Belfry

label: Description
value: Design for a bronze bell and hanging beam decorated with foliate arabesques. Below, a cross-section of a double tiered belfry, showing four bells.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Tapestry: Allegory of Africa

label: Description
value: A central group of women are flanked at left by a river god and at right by three figures.  The Queen of Africa, crowned with ostrich feathers is shown seated holding a mace. At her right stands a woman who carries a sheaf of grain with her left arm and holds aloft a feather or offering with her raised right hand. She wears the head of an elephant as a headdress; a lion accompanies her. A third woman is seated beside the Queen and looks toward her while pointing to the left.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and brown ink, black wash, white gouache,over black chalk on laid paper. Framing lines in pen and black ink.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Leon Decloux.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
